refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: mdaq_ao_write(channels, range, data) mdaq_ao_write(linkID, channels, range, data)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function writes MicroDAQ analog outputs. The channels argument can be a scalar or vector and it should contain channels numbers according to MicroDAQ hardware configuration. The range argument specifies channel output range. Matrix n-by-2 where n is number of used channels shall be provided. If 1x2 matrix is provided, the range setting will be used for all channels. In order to obtain supported ranges use mdaq_hwinfo().

listitem.para: channels: Single channel or array of channels numbers to read

range: Range matrix - single row matrix e.g. [-10,10] sets -10 to 10V output range which will be used for all channels. If multi-range used, row number must match selected channels e.g. range matrix for 3 channels [-10,10; -5,5; -2,2]

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: // set 1, 2, 3, 4V on 1, 2, 3, 4 channel with range 0 to 5V mdaq_ao_write([2, 4, 6, 8], [0,5], [1, 2, 3, 4]);
refsection.para: Calling function with linkID for shorter access time
